intro: Peucedanum nodosum, commonly known as nodding cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots, parsley, and celery, and is characterized by its umbel-shaped flowers and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its flowers are usually white or pale blue, and it blooms from late spring to early summer. Peucedanum nodosum is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it is sometimes used in traditional herbal medicine.
